Sigil of Jerusalem.name: Sigil of Jerusalem
Sigil of Jerusalem.description:
The Sigil of Jerusalem is a massive Adventure Module, spanning levels 1 to 10, filled with massive dungeons, legendary NPCs, immersive handouts and soundtracks, and a deep and branching storyline.

The year is 1182, and the Crusades came to a halt as an unexpected truce was struck between Baldwin and Saladin. Hidden behind this peace is an occult war, against an eldritch threat, awakening deep below in the catacombs of Jerusalem and the dunes of Cairo.

The adventurers must carve their path to fight back against the eldritch forces, corrupted knights, accursed beasts, and mythical creatures – to survive, to thwart, or to usurp the dark powers of eons past.

Shocking Grasp.name: Shocking Grasp
Shocking Grasp.description:
Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description:
A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends or until you use your action to dismiss it. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can't change your body type, so you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel your head and hair. If you use this spell to appear thinner than you are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch you would bump into you while it was seemingly still in midair.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

activation.condition: Which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls &Reference[unconscious] until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren't affected by this spell.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

materials.value: A pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description: The creature affected by this spell falls Unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed] for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description: The target is Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
You teleport yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle, 300 feet."

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell.

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 force damage, and the spell fails to teleport you.

Shatter.name: Shatter
Shatter.description:
A sudden loud ringing noise, painfully intense, erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw.

A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 3 or higher level spell slot, the damage of the spell increases by 1d8 for each level of higher spell slot 2.

materials.value: A chip of mica

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. Yakup casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit):

At will: shocking grasp, detect magic, magic missile, ray of frost

3/day: disguise self, shield, sleep, hold person

1/day: dimension door, shatter, fireball, dispel magic

Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

Locket of Yakup.description: Yakup can cast @UUID[.X8VjAvdYQo91FPMV]{mage armor} at will.

Shapechanger.name: Shapechanger
Shapechanger.description: The Aji Asil can shapechange into any beast with a CR 2 or lower using an action. Its mental ability scores stay the same, but other statistics change. Any object carried or worn is subsumed into the new form. It can use its bonus action to return to its original form, or revert to its original form when it reaches 0 hit points. Any remaining damage transfers to its original form.

The creatures that fail the saving throw are caught fire. Unless an action is spent to put it out, a target takes [[/damage 1d6 fire average]] damage at the start of each of its turns for the next minute.

The Aji Asil exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw.

Faithful’s Robe.name: Faithful’s Robe
Faithful’s Robe.description: The wearer’s Armor Class becomes 14 while wearing and attuned to the item. The wearer must be of good alignment and must not use or hold weapons to be able to benefit from the abilities.

Divine Aura.description: Father Godfrey adds its Wisdom modifier to each of his saving throws.

Sacred Touch.name: Sacred Touch
Sacred Touch.description: When Father Godfrey spends 1 hour and uses 10 gd worth of powdered silver with a flask of water, it becomes a flask of holy water.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Father Godfrey casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14)

Cantrips (at will): guidance, spare the dying

3/day each: detect evil and good, bless, purify food and drink

1/day each: lesser restoration, prayer of healing, calm emotions

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is a spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom.

Guidance.name: 神导术
Guidance.description: 你触碰一个自愿的生物。在法术终止前，目标可以选择在一次属性检定时额外掷一粒 d4，并将所得数值加入检定结果中。它可以在进行属性检定之前或之后掷骰。法术随后即终止。

Spare the Dying.name: 维生术
Spare the Dying.description: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you know if there is an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

materials.value: A sprinkling of holy water

Purify Food and Drink.name: Purify Food and Drink
Purify Food and Drink.description: All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range is purified and rendered free of poison and disease.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Prayer of Healing.name: Prayer of Healing
Prayer of Healing.description:
Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range each regain Hit Points equal to 2d8 + your Spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on Undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the Healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

Calm Emotions.name: Calm Emotions
Calm Emotions.description:
You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects. You can suppress any effect causing a target to be charmed or frightened. When this spell ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Alternatively, you can make a target indifferent about creatures of your choice that it is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the spell ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise.

Sacred Voice.name: Sacred Voice
Sacred Voice.description: The soothing voice of Father Godfrey surrounds three creatures of his choice within 60 ft. that can hear him. The creatures are forced to make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they take 3 (1d6) psychic damage and drop whatever they are holding. On a successful save, they take only half the damage.

Unity With Shadows.name: Unity With Shadows
Unity With Shadows.description: The karabasan can move through solid objects but takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn in a solid object. Additionally, it can turn invisible as a bonus action if it is within dim light or darkness. The invisibility stays until the end of its next turn, until it makes an attack or casts a spell.

Suffocation.name: Suffocation
Suffocation.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, one target, reach 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4). The creature is forced to make a DC 11 Charisma saving throw, or their Constitution score decreases by 1.

The Burden on Your Chest.name: The Burden on Your Chest
The Burden on Your Chest.description: As a bonus action, the Karabasan can strike a foe within 15 ft. of it and run towards it without provoking opportunity attacks. The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked &Reference[prone]. The Karabasan sits on the creature. While sitting on it, the creature is &Reference[paralyzed], and Karabasan weighs 5 times heavier. When any attempt is made to move Karabasan off the creature, it has +10 bonus to related ability checks or saving throws due to its weight.

The Suffocating Mark.name: The Suffocating Mark
The Suffocating Mark.description: When the Karabasan sits on a creature, it leaves a mark of horror. At the end of each long rest, the creature must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. During the paralysis, the creature can’t breathe. Each day, the duration increases by 1 minute. The mark of horror can be identified by a DC 10 Intelligence (Arcana) or Wisdom (Nature) check or an identify spell cast on the creature.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: When Luigi stands in front of a surface, he can spend his bonus action to camouflage himself by changing the colors of his scale. His transformation can only be discerned by a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check.

Magical Nature.name: Magical Nature
Magical Nature.description: Luigi can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A3q2gTNqG6fvNGrv]{disguise self} (3/day) and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1N8dDMMgZ1h1YJ3B]{invisibility} (1/day) spells innately. Other than normal, he can cast the disguise self spell on others by touching them. In addition, he is always under the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.aL1F8fvYLtNzUbKu]{speak with animals} spell.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends or until you use your action to dismiss it. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can't change your body type, so you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel your head and hair. If you use this spell to appear thinner than you are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch you would bump into you while it was seemingly still in midair.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

materials.value: An eyelash encased in gum arabic

Invisibility.name: 隐形
Invisibility.description: 你或一个你触碰的生物变为隐形，直至法术终止。任何保持在目标身上的着装物和携带物也可以维持隐形状态。 如果目标发动攻击或施展法术，则该法术终止。

Separate Eyes.name: Separate Eyes
Separate Eyes.description: Luigi’s two eyes can move independently of one another. He has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Deathly Stare.name: Deathly Stare
Deathly Stare.description: Luigi focuses his eyes on two creatures within 60 ft. of him. The creatures must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on their next attack roll or ability check.

The Red Bandana.name: The Red Bandana
The Red Bandana.description: While Abu-Dujana wears the red bandana, its Armor Class is 17, and he has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Yatagan.name: Yatagan
Yatagan.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Abu-Dujana makes two melee attacks.

Thunderous Roar.name: Thunderous Roar
Thunderous Roar.description: Each creature within 15 ft. of Abu-Dujana must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creatures take 7 (2d6) lightning damage plus 7 (2d6) thunder damage.

Deadliest Blade.name: Deadliest Blade
Deadliest Blade.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, plus 17 (5d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Arcane Veil.name: Arcane Veil
Arcane Veil.description: The Ajal’ayn can turn invisible as an action until it makes an attack or casts a spell.

Assassin Programming.name: Assassin Programming
Assassin Programming.description: The Ajal’ayn always has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn in combat yet, and any hit it scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If Ajal’ayn is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

Poison Mastery.name: Poison Mastery
Poison Mastery.description: The Ajal’ayn can apply its deadly poison to its weapons as a bonus action. The poison remains effective until it successfully hits a target.

Infiltrate And Escape.name: Infiltrate And Escape
Infiltrate And Escape.description: As a bonus action, the Ajal’ayn can take the Disengage or Hide action.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Atash-Parvaz makes two attacks with its Flaming Fists.

Flaming Fists.name: Flaming Fists
Flaming Fists.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) fire damage.

Arcane Flames.name: Arcane Flames
Arcane Flames.description: The Atash-Parvaz can release a burst of fire in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they catch fire. At the start of each of their turns for the next minute, the target takes 7 (2d6) fire damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Other than the saving throw, only magically created water or a wind spell cast on the creature can end the effect (it must at least be a 2nd-level spell).

Flaming Aura.name: Flaming Aura
Flaming Aura.description: When a creature enters the Flaming Aura for the first time or starts its turn there, it (or any metal object inside the aura) falls under the effects of heat metal spell. This aura can be turned off with a bonus action.

Immutable Form.name: Immutable Form
Immutable Form.description: Atash-Parvaz is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Brute Warrior Of The Wolf Sigill.name: Brute Warrior Of The Wolf Sigill
Brute Warrior Of The Wolf Sigill.tokenName: Brute Warrior Ot The Wolf Sigill

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The brute warrior makes two Blighted Blade attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with Otherworldly Suffocation.

Blighted Blade.name: Blighted Blade
Blighted Blade.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) psychic damage.

Otherworldly Suffocation.name: Otherworldly Suffocation
Otherworldly Suffocation.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: The target becomes grappled (escape DC 14) and takes 1d4 psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.

Otherworldly Mark Of Corruption.name: Otherworldly Mark Of Corruption
Otherworldly Mark Of Corruption.description: The brute warrior forces a creature within 30 ft. of it to make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains one level of Corruption. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of the next short or long rest.

Corrupting Presence.name: Corrupting Presence
Corrupting Presence.description: When a creature sees the brute warrior for the first time, it must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw, or be frightened of it for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. It is refreshed after 24 hours. If the creature fails the saving throw more than 5, it becomes corrupted and gains one level of corruption.

Breastplate.name: Breastplate
Breastplate.description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
Chain Mail.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Scimitar.name: Scimitar
Scimitar.description: This curved blade is wide near the wrapped handle but arcs and tapers towards a gleaming tip.

Fearless.name: Fearless
Fearless.description: The emir has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Relentless Pursuit.name: Relentless Pursuit
Relentless Pursuit.description: The emir can use its bonus action to command its allies within 30 ft and that can hear or see him. The creatures can use their reaction to move up to half their movement speed. They don’t provoke opportunity attacks.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The emir can make three scimitar attacks.

Ashen Touch.name: Ashen Touch
Ashen Touch.description: Ranged or Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 60 ft. , two targets. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage. If a creature is killed with this action, its ashes can always be summoned by using the Ashes of the Ancient ability.

Flame Eruption (Recharge 5-6).name: Flame Eruption (Recharge 5-6)
Flame Eruption (Recharge 5-6).description: In a 60 ft. radius, the Odparvar unleashes a deadly flame. Creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d6) fire damage plus 14 (4d6) force damage.

Ashes Of The Ancient (3/day).name: Ashes Of The Ancient (3/day)
Ashes Of The Ancient (3/day).description: By providing proper ashes or remains of a dead humanoid, the Odparvar can summon the spirit of the ashes by focusing on them for 1 minute. The remains gain the intellect and memory of the deceased humanoid for 1 minute, during which they can be communicated with. It is not obligated to answer any question and due to its spirit condition, its answers can be cryptic or unusual.

Brute Knight Of The Wolf Sigil.name: Brute Knight Of The Wolf Sigil
Brute Knight Of The Wolf Sigil.tokenName: Brute Knight Of The Wolf Sigil

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The brute knight makes two Blighted Blade attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with Otherworldly Suffocation.

Blighted Blade.name: Blighted Blade
Blighted Blade.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) psychic damage.

Otherworldly Suffocation.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: The target becomes grappled (escape DC 14) and takes 1d4 psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.

Otherworldly Mark Of Corruption.name: Otherworldly Mark Of Corruption
Otherworldly Mark Of Corruption.description: he brute warrior forces a creature within 30 ft. of it to make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains one level of Corruption. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of the next short or long rest.

Corrupting Presence.name: Corrupting Presence
Corrupting Presence.description: When a creature sees the brute knight for the first time, it must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw, or be frightened of it for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. It is refreshed after 24 hours. If the creature fails the saving throw by more than 5, it becomes corrupted and gains one level of corruption.

The Knightly Strike.name: The Knightly Strike
The Knightly Strike.description: Its weapon attacks score a critical hit on the roll of 18, 19, and 20.

Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
Chain Mail.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Artistic Inspiration.name: Artistic Inspiration
Artistic Inspiration.description: The traveling artist can inspire an ally within 60 ft. of it that can hear it. The ally has advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw made in the next minute.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Light Crossbow.name: Light Crossbow
Light Crossbow.description: A small crossbow with a wooden haft and a tense cord which is capable of firing a single bolt which can puncture even heavy armor at close range.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The traveling artist can cast these spells. Charisma is its spellcasting ability (DC 13).

At will: vicious mockery, dancing lights

3/day each: command, charm person, identify

1/day each: sleep, heat metal, suggestion, thunderwave

the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is a spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma.

Vicious Mockery.name: Vicious Mockery
Vicious Mockery.description:
You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

materials.value: A bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description:
You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is &Reference[charmed] by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description: The target is Charmed by the caster until the spell ends. The charmed creature regards the caster as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed.

Identify.name: Identify
Identify.description:
You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

materials.value: A pearl worth at least 100gp and an owl feather

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls &Reference[unconscious] until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren't affected by this spell.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

materials.value: A pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description: The creature affected by this spell falls Unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Heat Metal.name: Heat Metal
Heat Metal.description:
Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 fire damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

materials.value: A piece of iron and a flame.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do.

You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.

If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.

materials.value: A snake's tongue and either a bit of honeycomb or a drop of sweet oil

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the spell's effect, and the spell emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: A thin tensile metal blade, light in weight but long in reach designed for quick darting attacks to target weak points in enemy defenses with lightning swiftness.

Rotten Quarterstaff.name: Rotten Quarterstaff
Rotten Quarterstaff.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage when held with two hands, plus 2 (1d4) necrotic damage.

Rotten Touch (Melee).name: Rotten Touch (Melee)
Rotten Touch (Melee).description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

Rotting Flesh.name: Rotting Flesh
Rotting Flesh.description: Creatures that hit the djinnstruck within 5 ft. take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

Rotten Touch (Ranged).name: Rotten Touch (Ranged)
Rotten Touch (Ranged).description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, ranged 30 ft. , one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Baraq-Hamil makes three attacks with its Thunderous Slam.

Thunderous Slam.name: Thunderous Slam
Thunderous Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) thunder damage plus 7 (2d6) lightning damage.

Thunderous Retaliation.name: Thunderous Retaliation
Thunderous Retaliation.description: Whenever the Baraq-Hamil is hit, it can use its reaction to deal half of the damage it took back to its attacker, if it is within 60 ft. of it.

Thunderous Restoration.name: Thunderous Restoration
Thunderous Restoration.description: Whenever the Baraq-Hamil is hit by lightning or thunder damage, it regains hit points equal to 14 (4d6).

Kharim Al-ghalib, Custodian Of The Sands.name: Kharim Al-ghalib, Custodian Of The Sands
Kharim Al-ghalib, Custodian Of The Sands.tokenName: Kharim Al-ghalib, Custodian Of The Sands

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The custodian makes two attacks with its Spear of the Sands.

Spear Of The Sands.name: Spear Of The Sands
Spear Of The Sands.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

Paralyzing Breath.name: Paralyzing Breath
Paralyzing Breath.description: The custodian exhales a sleeping gas in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

The Protection Command.name: The Protection Command
The Protection Command.description: If the custodian is commanded to guard a place or a creature, the custodian has advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws while within 30 ft. of the place or the creature.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Madd-Jazir makes two attacks with its ice lance.

Ice Lance.name: Ice Lance
Ice Lance.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, plus 16 (3d10) cold damage.

Freezing Breath.name: Freezing Breath
Freezing Breath.description: The Madd-Jazir exhales a freezing wind in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Frozen Bones.name: Frozen Bones
Frozen Bones.description: All creatures within 60 ft. of the Madd-Jazir that took cold damage in the last two rounds must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly frozen. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to ice and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming frozen on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The freezing lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. The frozen condition can be considered as the petrified condition.

Freezing Aura.name: Freezing Aura
Freezing Aura.description: Each creature that hits the Madd-Jazir within 10 ft. of it takes 5 (2d4) cold damage.

Magic Disruption.name: Magic Disruption
Magic Disruption.description: The Muhafiz Al-Sihir emits a burst of anti-magic energy. All creatures within 15 feet that are concentrating on a spell must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or lose concentration.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a spellcaster or a creature that uses magical abilities, they must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on spellcasting ability checks and cannot cast spells of 3rd level or higher until the end of their next turn.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Muhafiz Al-Sihir has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Spell Nullify.name: Spell Nullify
Spell Nullify.description: When a spell is cast within 60 ft. of the Muhafiz Al-Sihir, it can use its reaction to attempt to counter the spell. The caster must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or the spell and the slot are lost.

Anti-magic Aura.name: Anti-magic Aura
Anti-magic Aura.description: With a bonus action, the Muhafiz Al-Sihir creates an aura that has a 10-foot radius. It has the qualities of an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ]{antimagic field} spell.

Mage Slayer.name: Mage Slayer
Mage Slayer.description: When a spell is cast within 10 ft. of the Muhafiz Al-Sihir, it can use its reaction to attack the caster with a Slam.

Risen Knight Of The Phoenix Sigil.name: Risen Knight Of The Phoenix Sigil
Risen Knight Of The Phoenix Sigil.tokenName: Risen Knight Of The Phoenix Sigil

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Risen Knight makes three attacks with its longsword.

Risen Longsword.name: Risen Longsword
Risen Longsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Ashen Restoration.name: Ashen Restoration
Ashen Restoration.description: When the Risen Knight drops below half of its hit point maximum, it can use its bonus action to regain 7 (2d6) hit points. Each hit reveals ashes from its body, and this feature kindles the ashes to heal wounds magically.

activation.condition: Drops below half of its hit point maximum

Ashen Retribution.name: Ashen Retribution
Ashen Retribution.description: Instead of healing, the Risen Knight can cause its next received hit to deal radiant damage to the attacker equal to double the amount healed by Ashen Restoration: 14 (4d6) radiant damage.

Rekindle.name: Rekindle
Rekindle.description: When the Risen Knight drops to 0 hit points, it regenerates to 1 hit point after 1d4+1 rounds unless it takes necrotic damage, which can permanently kill it.

Risen Warrior Of The Phoenix Sigil.name: Risen Warrior Of The Phoenix Sigil
Risen Warrior Of The Phoenix Sigil.tokenName: Risen Warrior Of The Phoenix Sigil

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Risen Warrior makes two attacks with its greatsword.

Risen Greatsword.name: Risen Greatsword
Risen Greatsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
Chain Mail.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Ashen Restoration.name: Ashen Restoration
Ashen Restoration.description: When the Risen Warrior drops below half of its hit point maximum, it can use its bonus action to regain 7 (2d6) hit points. Each hit reveals ashes from its body, and this feature kindles the ashes to heal wounds magically.

Ashen Retribution.name: Ashen Retribution
Ashen Retribution.description: Instead of healing, the Risen Warrior can cause its next received hit to deal radiant damage to the attacker equal to double the amount healed by Ashen Restoration, 14 (4d6) radiant damage.

Thunder hit.name: Thunder hit
Thunder hit.description: After each hit, all the creatures on the platform or within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 1d4 thunder damage and is pushed 10 ft. away from the platform. On a success, the creature takes only half the damage.

Necrotic hit.name: Necrotic hit
Necrotic hit.description: After each hit, all the creatures on the platform or within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 1d6 necrotic damage or half as much on a successful save.

Charm hit.name: Charm hit
Charm hit.description: After each hit, all the creatures on the platform or within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creatures are charmed and must spend their next action to move 10 feet to the edge of the platform. If one reaches the edge and has still not completed 10 ft. of movement, the creature falls from the edge.

Blind hit.name: Blind hit
Blind hit.description: After each hit, all the creatures on the platform or within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creatures are blinded for the next 1d6 rounds.

Petrify hit.name: Petrify hit
Petrify hit.description: After each hit, all the creatures on the platform or within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creatures are restrained and begin to petrify. At the start of their next turn, they repeat the saving throw; on a failed save, they are petrified for 24 hours. On a success, the petrification ends.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

Unholy Gaze.name: Unholy Gaze
Unholy Gaze.description: The risen saint forces a creature within 30 ft. of it to succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5 (2d4) necrotic damage. If the creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it gains one level of exhaustion or corruption (GM’s choice).

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces the risen saint to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the risen saint drops to 1 hit point instead.

Unholy Aura.name: Unholy Aura
Unholy Aura.description: Creatures within 10 ft. of the risen saint must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage each time they start their turn in the aura or enter the aura for the first time in their turn.

Sir Claude of Paris.name: Sir Claude of Paris
Sir Claude of Paris.tokenName: Risen Knight Of The Phoenix Sigil

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Risen Knight makes three attacks with its longsword.

Risen Longsword.name: Risen Longsword
Risen Longsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Ashen Restoration.name: Ashen Restoration
Ashen Restoration.description: When the Risen Knight drops below half of its hit point maximum, it can use its bonus action to regain 7 (2d6) hit points. Each hit reveals ashes from its body, and this feature kindles the ashes to heal wounds magically.

activation.condition: Drops below half of its hit point maximum

Ashen Retribution.name: Ashen Retribution
Ashen Retribution.description: Instead of healing, the Risen Knight can cause its next received hit to deal radiant damage to the attacker equal to double the amount healed by Ashen Restoration: 14 (4d6) radiant damage.

Rekindle.name: Rekindle
Rekindle.description: When the Risen Knight drops to 0 hit points, it regenerates to 1 hit point after 1d4+1 rounds unless it takes necrotic damage, which can permanently kill it.

Loyalty to the Phoenix.name: Loyalty to the Phoenix
Loyalty to the Phoenix.description: Unlike other Sigil Knights, Sir Claude can be resurrected by Sigil of the Phoenix even if he takes necrotic damage.

We Do Not Talk About the Sigils.name: We Do Not Talk About the Sigils
We Do Not Talk About the Sigils.description: Sir Claude of Paris can use his reaction to deal himself a deadly blow to intervene in his potential capture. When he does, he takes necrotic damage equal to half of his maximum hit points (51 necrotic damage). This reaction can be triggered by a spell that would incapacitate him, or by some other restraining condition, or when the potential superiority of his foes is ensured with a fallen comrade or similar circumstances.

Frighten the Prey.name: Frighten the Prey
Frighten the Prey.description: Sir Claude’s smile and vitality remind one creature within 60 ft. of him of their mortality and fragility. A construct or an undead is immune to this effect. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of Sir Claude for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

King’s Voice.name: King’s Voice
King’s Voice.description: King Baldwin targets up to three creatures within 60 ft. The creatures must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they take 16 (3d10) psychic damage or half as much on a successful one.

Longsword (+3).name: Longsword (+3)
Longsword (+3).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with both hands.

Deteriorating Health.name: Deteriorating Health
Deteriorating Health.description: Due to his leprosy, King Baldwin’s Constitution score is 6 and his Strength score is 8. If a creature comes into physical contact with the king, they may catch leprosy.

King’s Presence.name: King’s Presence
King’s Presence.description: All allies that can hear or see the king within 60 ft. of him have +2 bonus to their Armor Class and have advantage on death saving throws.

King’s Command.name: King’s Command
King’s Command.description: King Baldwin can use his bonus action to command up to three humanoids within 60 ft. of him that can hear or see him. The humanoid can use its reaction to issue the command. The commands can be: attack, move up to half its speed (does not provoke opportunity attacks), use an object, hide, stand up (with 5 ft. of movement), prone, or shove.

Advocatus.name: Advocatus
Advocatus.description: When a creature drops to 0 hit points for the first time within 60 ft. of King Baldwin, they drop to 1 hit points instead and gain 2d6 temporary hit points.

Longsword (+2).name: Longsword (+2)
Longsword (+2).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Guy adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Guy must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

The Risen Sigil Knight.name: The Risen Sigil Knight
The Risen Sigil Knight.description: When Guy drops to 0 hit points, he drops to 1 point instead. Each time after the first usage, he must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to gain another use of this ability. The DC increases by 5 for each use after the second. It resets when Guy finishes a long rest.

Sigil’s Mark.name: Sigil’s Mark
Sigil’s Mark.description: When Guy touches a willing humanoid, it is marked by his sigil. The target has advantage on Constitution saving throws and death saving throws for 24 hours.

The Sigil’s Touch.name: The Sigil’s Touch
The Sigil’s Touch.description: If Guy deems worthy he can touch a dead humanoid carrying his Sigil’s Mark. The humanoid rises as a Risen Warrior. If Guy suffers two levels of exhaustion and loses 4d6 current HP, the humanoid rises as a Risen Knight.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: Guy has advantage against being charmed and can’t be put to sleep by magic.

Elven Trance.name: Elven Trance
Elven Trance.description: Guy can complete a long rest by meditating for 4 hours.

The Silver Cloak.name: The Silver Cloak
The Silver Cloak.description:
Adorned with handwoven symbols of Christian and Mesopotamian origins, the wielder of this cloak is surrounded by a gentle hum of singing and whispers.
It is currently worn by the brave knight of Jerusalem: Guy of Lusignan.
This silver robe grants the wearer +2 bonus to Armor Class and advantage on all saving throws.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Al-Jazari makes three Psychic Blast attacks. Psychic Blast: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. , one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) psychic damage.

The Spell Creator.name: The Spell Creator
The Spell Creator.description: Al-Jazari has several spells after his name and has some expertise with a certain amount of them. He can cast these spells without expending a spell slot (at will if they are cantrips or 1/day if they normally require spell slots): Al-Biruni’s fantastic quill, Al-Farghani’s alchemy, Al-Jazari’s metalsmith, Al-Jazari’s woodwork, bedouin fabrics, Al-Jazari’s practical summons, Al-Jazari’s flexible casting, Al-Jazari’s greater summons, Al-Jazari’s marvelous duplicates, Al-Jazari’s Infernal Metals, Al-Jazari’s Wondrous Armory, true awareness, counterspell, dispel magic.

Arcane Ark.name: Arcane Ark
Arcane Ark.description: Al-Jazari has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Wondrous Armor.name: Wondrous Armor
Wondrous Armor.description: Al-Jazari’s robe is actually a magic item called Wondrous Armor. While wearing this robe, Al-Jazari’s Armor Class is 16, and he can reroll a saving throw he failed once a day and must use the new roll.

The Machine’s Mind.name: The Machine’s Mind
The Machine’s Mind.description: Al-Jazari can grant intellect to a construct. The construct’s Intelligence score becomes 8. This transformation lasts for 8 hours. The construct can speak if it has a part resembling the mouth and learn a language of Al-Jazari’s choice (usually Turkish or Arabic).

The Machine’s Heart.name: The Machine’s Heart
The Machine’s Heart.description: Al-Jazari can take control of a construct by spending a spell slot as an action. The construct must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the construct is under Al-Jazari’s control indefinitely.

The Broken Things.name: The Broken Things
The Broken Things.description: Al-Jazari can cast mending as a bonus action and immediately fix any broken material (maximum of 15-foot cube area and excluding magical materials).

The Perfect Wizard.name: The Perfect Wizard
The Perfect Wizard.description: Al-Jazari has a unique spellbook: it includes all wizard spells that are 5th-level or lower. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). He usually prepares these spells: Cantrips (at will): shocking grasp (3d8), message, minor illusion, mending, fire bolt (3d10) 1st level (4 slots): magic missile, comprehend languages, sleep, find familiar, grease 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, enlarge/reduce, darkness 3rd level (3 slots): fireball, counterspell, slow 4th level (3 slots): arcane eye, polymorph, greater invisibility 5th level (2 slots): animate objects, hold monster.

Psychic Blast (Meelee).name: Psychic Blast (Meelee)
Psychic Blast (Meelee).description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) psychic damage.

Psychic Blast (Ranged).name: Psychic Blast (Ranged)
Psychic Blast (Ranged).description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) psychic damage.

Shocking Grasp.name: Shocking Grasp
Shocking Grasp.description:
Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Message.name: Message
Message.description:
You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid Objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn't have to follow a straight line and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

materials.value: A short piece of copper wire

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

materials.value: A bit of fleece.

Mending.name: Mending
Mending.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object.

materials.value: Two lodestones

Fire Bolt.name: Fire Bolt
Fire Bolt.description:
You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

Comprehend Languages.name: Comprehend Languages
Comprehend Languages.description:
For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text.

This spell doesn't decode secret messages in a text or a glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn't part of a written language.

materials.value: A pinch of soot and salt

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls &Reference[unconscious] until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren't affected by this spell.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

materials.value: A pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description: The creature affected by this spell falls Unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Find Familiar.name: Find Familiar
Find Familiar.description:
You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.qav2dvMIUiMQCCsy]{bat}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.hIf83RD3ZVW4Egfi]{cat}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8RgUhb31VvjUNZU1]{crab}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EZgiprHXA2D7Uyb3]{frog} (toad), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.fnkPNfIpS62LqOu4]{hawk}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.I2x01hzOjVN4NUjf]{lizard}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.3UUNbGiG2Yf1ZPxM]{octopus}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.d0prpsGSAorDadec]{owl}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5rwVIxmfFrdyyxT]{poisonous snake}, fish (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.nkyCGJ9wXeAZkyyz]{quipper}), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.pozQUPTnLZW8epox]{rat}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.LPdX5YLlwci0NDZx]{raven}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.FWSDiq9SZsdiBAa8]{sea horse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.28gU50HtG8Kp7uIz]{spider}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.WOdeacKCYVhgLDuN]{weasel}. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of a beast.

Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal.

When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again.

While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

As an action, you can temporarily dismiss your familiar. It disappears into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form. Choose one of the forms from the above list. Your familiar transforms into the chosen creature.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your action modifier for the roll.

materials.value: 10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier

Grease.name: Grease
Grease.description:
Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into difficult terrain for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

materials.value: A bit of pork rind or butter

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed] for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description: The target is Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Enlarge/Reduce.name: Enlarge/Reduce
Enlarge/Reduce.description:
You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the Duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.

If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

Enlarge. The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category—from Medium to Large, for example. If there isn't enough room for the target to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Strength Checks and Strength Saving Throws. The target's Weapons also grow to match its new size. While these Weapons are enlarged, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 extra damage.

Reduce. The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category—from Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Strength Checks and Strength Saving Throws. The target's Weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these Weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

materials.value: A pinch of powdered iron

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

materials.value: Bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

activation.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.

A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

materials.value: A drop of molasses.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

Arcane Eye.name: Arcane Eye
Arcane Eye.description:
You create an invisible, magical eye within range that hovers in the air for the duration.

You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has normal vision and darkvision out to 30 feet. The eye can look in every direction.

As an action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it can't enter another plane of existence. A solid barrier blocks the eye's movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.

materials.value: A bit of bat fur.

Polymorph.name: Polymorph
Polymorph.description:
This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a Shapechanger or a creature with 0 Hit Points.

The transformation lasts for the Duration, or until the target drops to 0 Hit Points or dies. The new form can be any beast whose Challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental Ability Scores, are replaced by the Statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its Alignment and personality.

The target assumes the Hit Points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked Unconscious.

The creature is limited in the Actions it can perform by the Nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast Spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its Equipment.

materials.value: A caterpillar cocoon

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: You or a creature you touch becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is Invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: The target becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is Invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

Animate Objects.name: Animate Objects
Animate Objects.description:
Objects come to life at your command. Choose up to ten nonmagical objects within range that are not being worn or carried. Medium targets count as two objects, Large targets count as four objects, Huge targets count as eight objects. You can't animate any object larger than Huge. Each target animates and becomes a creature under your control until the spell ends or until reduced to 0 hit points.

As a bonus action, you can mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.
