An animated object is a construct with AC, hit points, attacks, Strength, and Dexterity determined by its size. Its Constitution is 10 and its Intelligence and Wisdom are 3, and its Charisma is 1. Its speed is 30 feet; if the object lacks legs or other appendages it can use for locomotion, it instead has a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. If the object is securely attached to a surface or a larger object, such as a chain bolted to a wall, its speed is 0. It has blindsight with a radius of 30 feet and is blind beyond that distance. When the animated object drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original object form, and any remaining damage carries over to its original object form.

If you command an object to attack, it can make a single melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. It makes a slam attack with an attack bonus and bludgeoning damage determined by its size. The DM might rule that a specific object inflicts slashing or piercing damage based on its form.

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can animate two additional objects for each slot level above 5th.

Hold Monster.name: Hold Monster
Hold Monster.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[Paralyzed] for the Duration. This spell has no effect on Undead. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

Hold Monster.name: Hold Monster
Hold Monster.description: The target is Paralyzed for the Duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Al-Biruni’s Fantastic Quıll.name: Al-Biruni’s Fantastic Quıll
Al-Biruni’s Fantastic Quıll.description:
You touch an object with an avian feather to give it properties of a magical quill. The object must have some sort of a sharp part to be used. A wooden stick, a sharp stone, a metal shard, or a similar object would do.

The Marvelous Quill: The object can be used to write and produce its own magical ink when you activate it as an action. It can be used for writing on any solid surface for 1 hour. When you reach 5th level, you can spend 4 hours and 15 gd to produce a cantrip scroll of your choice. When you reach 11th level, you can spend 8 hours and 50 gd to produce a 1st level spell scroll of your choice. When you reach 17th level, you can spend 12 hours and 200 gd to produce a 2nd level spell scroll of your choice. The spells that you scribe as a scroll must be known to you or you must have them prepared.

The Unexpected Eraser: The object can be used to erase writing that is put on a surface within 1 day. The writing disappears, and the surface resembles as though it were never written. An identify spell cast on the surface reveals that the writing was erased and a dispel magic spell brings back the writing. When you reach 5th level, the duration of 1 day becomes 1 week. When you reach 11th level, the duration of 1 week becomes 1 month. When you reach 17th level, the duration of 1 month becomes indefinite.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Wizard

materials.value: an avian feather

Al-Farghani’s Alchemy.name: Al-Farghani’s Alchemy
Al-Farghani’s Alchemy.description:
You touch a tiny object and grant a magical property from below that is useful for daily life and in matters of taste, aroma, and similar things.

Beverage Shifter: When put into a cup, jug or a similar object filled with water or another liquid, it can turn the liquid into a liquid that is drinkable and harmless, such as juice, coffee, tea, or something similar. Unless consumed, the liquid turns into its original state after 10 minutes. This object can’t change the magical or other potentially harmless properties in the liquid (such as poison). When you reach 5th level, it can eliminate poisons and similar dangerous and non-magical properties. When you reach 11th level, it can change magical liquids into non-magical and harmless ones. When you reach 17th level, it can change magical liquids or normal ones into common or uncommon magical substances, such as turning water into a healing potion or a potion of fire resistance.

Magical Aroma: When applied to a creature, clothing or to a specific place, such as the corner of the room, kitchen counter or the dining table, it gives off a certain smell designated by you. It lasts for 1 hour. When you reach 5th level, you can make the aroma poisonous. You designate a point, and the air in a 5 foot radius area around that point becomes poisonous for anyone who enters or anyone who starts its turn there. They must make a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. When you reach 11th level, they also receive 1d8 poison damage on a failed save. When you reach 17th level, the damage becomes 2d8, and the radius extends to 15 feet. When you make the area poisonous, you must concentrate on this spell, and it lasts for 10 minutes.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

materials.value: a sprinkle of ginger

Al-Jazari’s Metalsmith.name: Al-Jazari’s Metalsmith
Al-Jazari’s Metalsmith.description:
You touch a tiny object made from metal to assign one of the features below to it. The features last until you dismiss them (no action required), after 1 hour, or when the feature says so.

Flame Tender: The object can start or snuff out fires on candles, torches, campfires and similar objects, as an action. At 5th level, you can use it to make a melee spell attack using your spellcasting ability scores to deal 1d6 fire damage as the part of your action to lit it and it is extinguished at the end of your turn. At 6th level its damage increases to 2d6. At 11th level, 3d6. At 17th level, 4d6.

Acid Mouth: The object produces 0.1 ounces of acid. This acid can be used to melt and pierce through locks, handles and similar things and disappears after 3 uses. At 5th level, you can use it to make a melee spell attack using your ability scores to deal 1d6 acid damage. At 6th level its damage increases to 2d6. At 11th level, 3d6. At 17th level, 4d6.

Arcanasteel Shield: The object must be a circular or of a similar shape that is proper for a shield. It becomes a disk big enough for your hand. When a creature attacks you, you can use your reaction to activate it. It magically appears on your arm and does not take your ability to use your hand and grants you +1 to your Armor Class until the end of your next turn. When you reach 5th level, it grants +2 to your AC.

Class Lists: Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: a small hammer

Al-Jazari’s Woodwork.name: Al-Jazari’s Woodwork
Al-Jazari’s Woodwork.description:
You touch a piece of wood that was carved into a shape by human hands and assign some features to it.

Water Diviner: The object can be used for 1 hour to guide you toward the nearest water source within 5 miles. You can use it to clean contaminated water of 5 gallons. It doesn’t remove poisons. When you reach 5th level, it can be used to duplicate the purify food and drink spell and it can’t be used again, until you finish a long rest. At 11th level, it can duplicate the create or destroy water spell and you can’t use the Water Diviner again until you finish a long rest. At 17th level, it can be used to cast create food or water and you can’t use the Water Diviner again until you finish a long rest.

Totemic Ward: This totem wards you from otherworldly threats. You designate a type of creature: Aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead. The object can be on a person, under a bed, or hanging above a door or a window to be active. While under the bed, whenever a chosen type of creature enters within 10 feet of the ward, it gives a designated sound, visual or scent and forces the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can’t come close to the ward until the end of its next turn and takes 1d6 psychic damage. The damage

increases to 2d6 when you reach 5th level, 3d6 when you reach 11th level, and 4d6 when you reach 17th level.

Sturdy Weapons: You touch five pieces of ammunition, a wooden club, a wooden quarterstaff or a similar wooden weapon and grant them magical properties for overcoming resistances against non-magical attacks. For the duration, they can’t be broken by normal means. For example, if you imbue 5 arrows, all can be collected after firing as normal ammunition. At 5th level, you double the number of ammunition or wooden weapons you can imbue. At 11th level, you triple the number.

Class Lists: Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: a small carving blade

Bedouin Fabrics.name: Bedouin Fabrics
Bedouin Fabrics.description:
You magically weave a tiny fabric to have magical aspects and choose one of the following options.

Saharan Haeadband: The object can be used as an action and grants advantage on saving throws related to extreme heat for the next hour to the creature using it. At 5th level, the creature wearing it is immune to the effects of extreme heat. At 11th level, the creature wearing it has advantage on death saving throws in extreme heat conditions.

Desertnight Scarf: The object can be used as an action and grants advantage on saving throws related to extreme cold for the next hour to the creature using it. At 5th level, the creature wearing the scarf is immune to the effects of extreme cold. At 11th level, the creature wearing the scarf has advantage on death saving throws in extreme cold conditions.

Surgeon’s Bandages: When you receive healing from a source, or roll a Hit Dice to recover hit points, the bandage helps you magically. You can reroll a 1 or 2 once, but you must use the new roll. The bandage then disappears. When you reach 5th level, it can be used twice without disappearing. At 11th level, it can be used 3 times.

You can only have up to 3 of the objects at the same time.

Class Lists: Bard, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard

materials.value: a piece of silk

Al-Jazari’s Practical Summons.name: Al-Jazari’s Practical Summons
Al-Jazari’s Practical Summons.description:
You conjure a solid and non-magical object that you have seen before within 15 ft. of you. The object must be Large or smaller, and its price must not exceed 150 gd. The object must not go further than 15 ft. from you or it disappears immediately. The object disappears 10 minutes later.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can conjure one more item equal to the slot’s level.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

materials.value: an owl’s feather

Al-Jazari’s Flexible Casting.name: Al-Jazari’s Flexible Casting
Al-Jazari’s Flexible Casting.description:
When you cast this spell, you can choose a 1st-level spell (its duration must be 1 action) from your spellbook and cast that spell instead. If the spell asks for a material component, you must have it on you.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher (maximum is 5th level to benefit this) you can duplicate a spell that is one level below from your spellbook.

Class Lists: Wizard

materials.value: a spellbook worth at least 50 gd

Al-Jazari’s Greater Summons.name: Al-Jazari’s Greater Summons
Al-Jazari’s Greater Summons.description:
When you cast this spell, you can conjure a magical item that you have seen before, it must not be a consumable item and must not be rarer than an uncommon item. It vanishes after 1 minute or you use a bonus action to dismiss the item.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot, you can conjure a rare item.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: a giant eagle’sfeather, worth at least 100 gd, which the spell consumes

Al-jazari's Marvelous Duplicates.name: Al-jazari's Marvelous Duplicates
Al-jazari's Marvelous Duplicates.description:
You touch an object that is tiny. It can be a magical item and can be consumable but it must not be rarer than Uncommon. Within 5 ft. of the object, an exact duplicate of the item appears with a small puff of smoke and stays there for 1 minute. If it is a consumable item, it can be used as normal and will affect normally.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, the item can be Rare. If you cast it with a 9th level spell slot, the item can be Very Rare.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: Identical flintstones worth at least 50 gd, which the spell consumes

Al-jazari's Infernal Metals.name: Al-jazari's Infernal Metals
Al-jazari's Infernal Metals.description:
You affect shields, armor, weapons, and all kinds of objects that are made of metal that are nonmagical in the range of the spell. The wearers or the ones that are in physical contact with the objects take 5d8 fire damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

If the wearer is wearing armor and does not doff the armor when the spell ends, the armor melts away and deals 8d8 fire damage to the wearer.

At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above the 4th.

Class Lists: Cleric, Wizard

Al-jazari's Wondrous Armory.name: Al-jazari's Wondrous Armory
Al-jazari's Wondrous Armory.description:
You choose up to 6 pieces of armor or weapons within 10 feet of you. When the casting of this spell is complete the armor and weapons are animated. You can summon a number of animated armor* or flying swords* with a total combined Challenge Rating of 2. For example, you can create 1 animated armor* and 4 flying swords*. The constructs take orders from you and act best as their ability allows them to. You must spend your bonus action to command them. Unless they take commands, they simply follow you and attack the nearest enemies or take dodge action.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

materials.value: A shard taken from a blade or a rusty piece of armor that is at least a thousand years old and is worth 500 gd, which the spell consumes

True Awareness.name: True Awareness
True Awareness.description:
For the duration, the creature you touch understands when it hears a lie, its passive Perception increases by 5, and has advantage on all Wisdom checks and saving throws.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: specially made peppermint worth at least 25 gd, which the spell consumes

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Sir Raynald makes two attacks with its flail.

Crimson Flail (+2).name: Crimson Flail (+2)
Crimson Flail (+2).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

Damage Absorption.name: Damage Absorption
Damage Absorption.description: When Sir Raynald takes damage, he adds half of it (minimum of 1) to the next damage he deals until the end of his next turn as the form of force damage. If he takes multiple forms of damage, he chooses which damage he is affected by. Once a day, he can maximize this ability with a bonus action. He stores all damage he received that round, and when he deals damage, he adds all damage he took to his next damage roll (if he does not deal damage for 2 rounds, this ability ends).

Superior Resistance.name: Superior Resistance
Superior Resistance.description: Sir Raynald always takes half damage from any source, even if it surpasses resistance.

Corrupting Strikes.name: Corrupting Strikes
Corrupting Strikes.description: When Sir Raynald scores a critical hit, he forces the creature to make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw; on a failed save, it gains one level of corruption.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Sultan Saladin makes three attacks with his sword.

The Sword Of Saladin (+3).name: The Sword Of Saladin (+3)
The Sword Of Saladin (+3).description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 +7) slashing damage or 12 (1d10 + 7) slashing damage when used with two hands.

Master Of Magic.name: Master Of Magic
Master Of Magic.description: Sultan Saladin can target a creature with an action within 60 ft. of him. The target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 14 (4d6) psychic damage or half as much on a successful one.

Sultan’s Mark (5/day).name: Sultan’s Mark (5/day)
Sultan’s Mark (5/day).description: Sultan Saladin can use his bonus action to target a creature within 120 ft. All attack rolls against that target have advantage on their attack rolls. The mark lasts for 1 minute and works as if concentrating on a spell.

Sultan’s Defiance.name: Sultan’s Defiance
Sultan’s Defiance.description: While within 120 ft. of Sultan Saladin, allies that can see or hear him add 1d6 to their attack rolls and saving throws.

As-serif.name: As-serif
As-serif.description: When an ally of Sultan Saladin that is within 30 ft. of him hits a creature with an attack roll made with a weapon it deals an additional 1d6 damage, the same damage type with the weapon.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
Innate Spellcasting.description:
Sultan Saladin casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

At will (each): Al-Jazari’s metalsmith, bedouin fabrics, Herculean might, produce flame, detect evil and good

3/day (each): faithful’s strike, command, Li Jin’s impervious charge, divine favor, true words for the saint

2/day (each): magic circle, banishment, Li Jin’s lightning charge, Zengi’s armor of faith, battle focus, slow

1/day (each): Li Jin’s ultimate command, dispel magic, counterspell, remove curse, telepathic bond

Al-Jazari’s Metalsmith.name: Al-Jazari’s Metalsmith
Al-Jazari’s Metalsmith.description:
You touch a tiny object made from metal to assign one of the features below to it. The features last until you dismiss them (no action required), after 1 hour, or when the feature says so.

Flame Tender: The object can start or snuff out fires on candles, torches, campfires and similar objects, as an action. At 5th level, you can use it to make a melee spell attack using your spellcasting ability scores to deal 1d6 fire damage as the part of your action to lit it and it is extinguished at the end of your turn. At 6th level its damage increases to 2d6. At 11th level, 3d6. At 17th level, 4d6.

Acid Mouth: The object produces 0.1 ounces of acid. This acid can be used to melt and pierce through locks, handles and similar things and disappears after 3 uses. At 5th level, you can use it to make a melee spell attack using your ability scores to deal 1d6 acid damage. At 6th level its damage increases to 2d6. At 11th level, 3d6. At 17th level, 4d6.

Arcanasteel Shield: The object must be a circular or of a similar shape that is proper for a shield. It becomes a disk big enough for your hand. When a creature attacks you, you can use your reaction to activate it. It magically appears on your arm and does not take your ability to use your hand and grants you +1 to your Armor Class until the end of your next turn. When you reach 5th level, it grants +2 to your AC.

Class Lists: Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

materials.value: a small hammer

Bedouin Fabrics.name: Bedouin Fabrics
Bedouin Fabrics.description:
You magically weave a tiny fabric to have magical aspects and choose one of the following options.

Saharan Haeadband: The object can be used as an action and grants advantage on saving throws related to extreme heat for the next hour to the creature using it. At 5th level, the creature wearing it is immune to the effects of extreme heat. At 11th level, the creature wearing it has advantage on death saving throws in extreme heat conditions.

Desertnight Scarf: The object can be used as an action and grants advantage on saving throws related to extreme cold for the next hour to the creature using it. At 5th level, the creature wearing the scarf is immune to the effects of extreme cold. At 11th level, the creature wearing the scarf has advantage on death saving throws in extreme cold conditions.

Surgeon’s Bandages: When you receive healing from a source, or roll a Hit Dice to recover hit points, the bandage helps you magically. You can reroll a 1 or 2 once, but you must use the new roll. The bandage then disappears. When you reach 5th level, it can be used twice without disappearing. At 11th level, it can be used 3 times.

You can only have up to 3 of the objects at the same time.

Class Lists: Bard, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard

materials.value: a piece of silk

Herculean Might.name: Herculean Might
Herculean Might.description:
Magic of the myths surrounds the target within range and it adds 1d6 to the failed check and possibly turn it into a success.

At Higher Levels: The bonus increases when you reach 5th level (1d8), 11th level (1d10), and 17th level (1d12).

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

activation.condition: when you or a creature within 30 feet of you fails a Strength or a Constitution check.

materials.value: a spinach leaf

Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
Produce Flame.description:
A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the Duration and harms neither you nor your Equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

You can also Attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell Attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 fire damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you know if there is an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Faithful's Strike.name: Faithful's Strike
Faithful's Strike.description:
You imbue your assault with your arcane potential. When you hit a creature you can choose to expend a spell slot to deal with an extra 2d10 damage of the same type as the weapon.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

activation.condition: With the action you hit a creature

materials.value: a melee weapon worth at least 1 cp

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Li Jin's Impervious Charge.name: Li Jin's Impervious Charge
Li Jin's Impervious Charge.description:
You invoke the arcane methodologies of the great Tang commander Li Jin to help your allies achieve greater measures of martial prowess. You choose a creature that you can see and that can hear you within range, and it can use its reaction to make an attack roll.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can affect one more creature for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

Divine Favor.name: Divine Favor
Divine Favor.description: Your prayer empowers you with divine radiance. Until the spell ends, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d4 radiant damage on a hit.

True Word For The Saint.name: True Word For The Saint
True Word For The Saint.description:
You point a finger at a creature you can see within range and ask a question. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must answer the question truthfully. You know if the creature has passed the saving throw or not.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin

Magic Circle.name: Magic Circle
Magic Circle.description:
You create a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-tall Cylinder of magical energy centered on a point on the ground that you can see within range. Glowing runes appear wherever the cylinder intersects with the floor or other surface.

Choose one or more of the following types of creatures: Celestials, Elementals, fey, Fiends, or Undead. The circle affects a creature of the chosen type in the following ways:

  • The creature can't willingly enter the cylinder by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to do so, it must first succeed on a Charisma saving throw.
  • The creature has disadvantage on Attack rolls against Targets within the Cylinder.
  • Targets within the cylinder can't be Charmed, Frightened, or possessed by the creature.

When you cast this spell, you can elect to cause its magic to operate in the reverse direction, preventing a creature of the specified type from leaving the cylinder and protecting targets outside it.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the Duration increases by 1 Hour for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: Holy water or powdered silver and iron worth at least 100gp, which the spell consumes

Banishment.name: Banishment
Banishment.description:
You attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished.

If the target is native to the plane of existence you're on, you banish the target to a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is &Reference[incapacitated]. The target remains there until the spell ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the target is banished with a faint popping noise, returning to its home plane. If the spell ends before 1 minute has passed, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Otherwise, the target doesn't return.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

materials.value: An item distasteful to the target

Banishment.name: Banishment
Banishment.description: The target native to this plane is banished to a harmless demiplane plane and is Incapacitated for the duration.

Li Jin's Lightning Charge.name: Li Jin's Lightning Charge
Li Jin's Lightning Charge.description:
You target yourself and up to two allies within 10 ft. of you. They can use their reaction to cooperate with you. All three of you can move up to your speed and deal one attack to a creature within your reach. If any of you use ranged weapons or throwable melee weapons, you can also make an attack roll with them against a creature within range. You can aim for the same or different targets.

On a hit, each attack deals additional 1d6 lightning damage. Instead of dealing extra damage, any of you can choose to push the target up to 10 ft. and force it to make a Strength saving throw. On a fail, they also fall prone.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

Class Lists: Bard, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer,

Warlock, Wizard

Zengi's Armor Of Faith.name: Zengi's Armor Of Faith
Zengi's Armor Of Faith.description:
You draw the sigils of the lords of Zengi to the aether, summoning the arcane might of the powerful masters who fought for the Holy Lands with great faith and pride. For the duration, each time you take damage, you reduce the damage by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus or equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (your choice when you cast the spell). If you reduce the damage to 0, you gain the remaining damage as temporary hit points. For the purpose of your concentration saving throws, no matter the damage, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to hold your concentration.

Class Lists: Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer

Battle Focus.name: Battle Focus
Battle Focus.description:
You touch a creature and improve their focus to an extreme level, granting them one of the following effects:

Combat Maneuvers: The target adds +2 to their attack rolls.

Arcane Determination: The target's spell save DC increases by 2.

Class Lists: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.

A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

materials.value: A drop of molasses.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

Li Jin's Ultimate Command.name: Li Jin's Ultimate Command
Li Jin's Ultimate Command.description:
An ally you choose is inspired by the words you invoke that belonged to great Tang commander Li Jin. Using your reaction you can inspire them to force their limits. They play an additional turn right after their normal turn ends in the initiative order.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 6th level spell slot, you can include one more of your allies that at least played one turn in the initiative order to take another turn right after this one.

Class Lists: Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

activation.condition: Can be triggered at the end of an ally's turn

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

activation.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

Remove Curse.name: Remove Curse
Remove Curse.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Telepathic Bond.name: Telepathic Bond
Telepathic Bond.description:
You forge a telepathic link among up to eight willing creatures of your choice within range, psychically linking each creature to all the others for the duration. Creatures with Intelligence scores of 2 or less aren't affected by this spell.

Until the spell ends, the targets can communicate telepathically through the bond whether or not they have a common language. The communication is possible over any distance, though it can't extend to other planes of existence.

materials.value: Pieces of eggshell from two different kinds of creatures

True Elemental Strike (Meelee).name: True Elemental Strike (Meelee)
True Elemental Strike (Meelee).description: Melee or Ranged Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 60 ft. , three targets. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 6) damage. The damage type can be: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning; her decision before each action. The damage ignores resistances.

Vessel Of The Mother.name: Vessel Of The Mother
Vessel Of The Mother.description: She can use a bonus action to grant herself resistance to all damage until the end of her next turn. Last Stand of the Dragon. When she drops below half of her hit point maximum, she gains +2 bonus to all attack rolls and damage rolls, including spells.

Arcane Absorption.name: Arcane Absorption
Arcane Absorption.description: When a spell is cast within 60 ft. of Sibylla, she can use her reaction to cast counterspell. When she successfully counters a spell, the caster takes force damage equal to her Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

Last Stand of the Dragon.name: Last Stand of the Dragon
Last Stand of the Dragon.description: When she drops below half of her hit point maximum, she gains +2 bonus to all attack rolls and damage rolls, including spells.

True Elemental Strike (Ranged).name: True Elemental Strike (Ranged)
True Elemental Strike (Ranged).description: Melee or Ranged Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 60 ft. , three targets. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 6) damage. The damage type can be: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning; her decision before each action. The damage ignore resistances.

Knife of Eden.name: Knife of Eden
Knife of Eden.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 9 to hit, reach 5 ft., two targets. Hit: 8 (1d6 +5) force damage.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
Innate Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. Sibylla casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

At will (each): fire bolt (3d10), minor illusion, true strike, chill touch (3d8)

3/day (each): sleep (3rd level), command, eldritch mark, Siyah Qalam’s infernal awareness

2/day (each): detect thoughts, hold person, see invisibility, slow, fireball, celestial force of attraction

1/day (each): blight, dominate person

Fire Bolt.name: Fire Bolt
Fire Bolt.description:
You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

materials.value: A bit of fleece.

True Strike.name: True Strike
True Strike.description: You extend your hand and point a finger at a target in range. Your magic grants you a brief insight into the target's defenses. On your next turn, you gain advantage on your first attack roll against the target, provided that this spell hasn't ended.

Chill Touch.name: Chill Touch
Chill Touch.description:
You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.

If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls &Reference[unconscious] until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren't affected by this spell.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

materials.value: A pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description: The creature affected by this spell falls Unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Eldritch Mark.name: Eldritch Mark
Eldritch Mark.description:
An eldritch dread erupts magically from your pointed finger towards an enemy within range. A dreaded scream is all that the target hears. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be marked for the duration. While the target is marked, whenever it takes damage, it takes extra psychic damage equal to your proficiency bonus and has disadvantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Class Lists: Ranger, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock

Siyah Qalam’s Infernal Awareness.name: Siyah Qalam’s Infernal Awareness
Siyah Qalam’s Infernal Awareness.description:
You look deep into the eyes of a creature that is not a humanoid and utter the words of infernal domination, first discovered by the master demonologist, Mehmed Siyah Qalam. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. If the target fails the Wisdom saving throw, you roll a d4 and add that to your Armor Class for all attacks against you coming from that target. If the target succeeds on the save you learn one of the following:

  • Its resistances

  • Its vulnerabilities

  • Its immunities

Alternatively, if you target an object you learn whether it is a magical object or not. When you do so it faintly glows only in your eyes, depending on its rarity: Blue for common, uncommon and rare; Purple for very rare and legendary.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 2nd level spell slot or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Class Lists: Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

materials.value: A copper piece

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed] for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description: The target is Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

See Invisibility.name: See Invisibility
See Invisibility.description: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

materials.value: A pinch of talc and a small sprinkling of silver powder

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.

A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

materials.value: A drop of molasses.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

Celestial Force Of Attraction.name: Celestial Force Of Attraction
Celestial Force Of Attraction.description:
When you see a spell being cast within range, you can call upon your arcane might to misalign gravity and change the spell's course, presenting yourself as the target.

If the spell targets a creature and is made with an attack roll (for example, guiding bolt), it takes your Armor Class into account, and if it forces one creature to make a saving throw and not an area of effect (for example hold person), you make the saving throws. If the spell succeeds, you are affected by the spell, not the original target. If the spell is an AoE attack (for example fireball), the center of the spell shifts to right below your feet.

If it's a healing spell, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell heals you.

If the spell normally targets one creature at its lowest level and now somehow affects more than one target (for example, due to upcasting or Metamagic), you can only alter one attack roll or one saving throw.

At Higher Levels: For each level above the 2nd, you gain +1 bonus to your Armor Class or saving throw.

Class Lists: Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

activation.condition: when you see a one target spell is being cast within 60 ft. of you

Blight.name: Blight
Blight.description:
Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes 8d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw, it simply withers and dies.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
You attempt to beguile a humanoid that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[charmed] by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the target is charmed, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time you can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description: The target is Charmed and must do its best to obey any commands sent by the caster.

The Remains Of Peter The Hermit.name: The Remains Of Peter The Hermit
The Remains Of Peter The Hermit.tokenName: The Remains Of Peter The Hermit

The Psychic Strike (Meelee).name: The Psychic Strike (Meelee)
The Psychic Strike (Meelee).description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 120 ft. , two targets. Hit: 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

Immobile.name: Immobile
Immobile.description: Peter the Hermit cannot move from his embedded location and is considered restrained.

Perfect Cover.name: Perfect Cover
Perfect Cover.description: Peter the Hermit is always considered to be in three quarters cover.

Other Selves.name: Other Selves
Other Selves.description: When Peter the Hermit drops to 0 hit points, he can use his reaction to pull an other self from his hundreds of consciousnesses. He must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to be able to do that. The DC is equal to the damage taken; however, it can’t be lower than 10.

Mind Absorption.name: Mind Absorption
Mind Absorption.description: By using his sigil, Peter the Hermit is able to absorb other minds into the Library Pageless. A target that is restrained, incapacitated or with 0 ft. of movement can be targeted by an action, if it touches the Library Pageless or a creature bearing the Sigil of Moth. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or the absorption process begins. For 24 hours, it must remain motionless. If it takes any damage or is moved more than 5 ft. the process fails. If the process succeeds, the target’s mind, memories and experiences are absorbed by the Library Pageless.

Part Of The Library.name: Part Of The Library
Part Of The Library.description: Peter the Hermit’s consciousness is so interwoven with the Library Pageless, if the library is not destroyed, he will come back alive after 1d10 days after being destroyed, provided finding a target.

Infinite Knowledge.name: Infinite Knowledge
Infinite Knowledge.description: Peter the Hermit knows all spells of 5th level or lower, except necromancy spells. He has four 1st-level spell slots, three 2nd-level spell slots, three 3rd-level spell slots, three 4th-level spell slots and two 5th-level spell slots. He uses Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (+9 to hit, DC 17). He usually have these spells prepared: At will: magic missile, shocking grasp (3d8), chill touch (3d8) 1st level (4 slots): bane, entangle, sanctuary 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, heat metal, hold person, mirror image 3rd level (3 slots): fireball, counterspell, dispel magic, sleet storm, slow 4th level (3 slots): dominate beast, blight, polymorph 5th level (2 slots): dominate person, wall of force.

The Psychic Strike (Ranged).name: The Psychic Strike (Ranged)
The Psychic Strike (Ranged).description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 120 ft. , two targets. Hit: 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

Shocking Grasp.name: Shocking Grasp
Shocking Grasp.description:
Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description:
Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Entangle.description:
Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the Duration, these Plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be &Reference[Restrained] by the entangling Plants until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

When the spell ends, the conjured Plants wilt away.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description: A creature in the area is Restrained by the entangling Plants until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a Fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, this spell ends.

Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 fire damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. You can use your action to dismiss the illusory duplicates.

Each time a creature targets you with an attack during the spell's duration, roll a [[/r 1d20 # Mirror Image Check]] to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your duplicates.

If you have three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher to change the attack's target to a duplicate. With two duplicates, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one duplicate, you must roll an 11 or higher.

A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

A creature is unaffected by this spell if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

activation.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Sleet Storm.name: Sleet Storm
Sleet Storm.description:
Until the spell ends, freezing rain and sleet fall in a 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls Prone.

If a creature is concentrating in the spell's area, the creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or lose concentration.

The target takes 8d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw, it simply withers and dies.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

Polymorph.name: Polymorph
Polymorph.description:
This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a Shapechanger or a creature with 0 Hit Points.

The transformation lasts for the Duration, or until the target drops to 0 Hit Points or dies. The new form can be any beast whose Challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental Ability Scores, are replaced by the Statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its Alignment and personality.

The target assumes the Hit Points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked Unconscious.

The creature is limited in the Actions it can perform by the Nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast Spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its Equipment.

materials.value: A caterpillar cocoon

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
You attempt to beguile a humanoid that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[charmed] by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the target is charmed, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time you can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description: The target is Charmed and must do its best to obey any commands sent by the caster.

Wall of Force.name: Wall of Force
Wall of Force.description:
An invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick. It lasts for the Duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by Dispel Magic. A Disintegrate spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through the wall.

materials.value: A pinch of powder made by crushing clear gemstone

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Babylon makes three attacks with any combination.

Mother’s Calling.name: Mother’s Calling
Mother’s Calling.description: Babylon targets a creature that she can see within 30 ft. of her. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 21 (6d6) psychic damage and immediately spends its reaction to move with all its possible speed to come closer to her. On a successful save, the target takes only half damage.

Embrace.name: Embrace
Embrace.description: Melee Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) force damage.

Sleeping Breath.name: Sleeping Breath
Sleeping Breath.description: Babylon exhales a special breath in a 60 ft. cone. All creatures within the area must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep for 1 minute or until they take damage. Creatures with the Fey Ancestry feature are immune to this effect.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description: The creature affected by this spell falls Unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: Babylon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Babylon regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Attack.name: Attack
Attack.description: Babylon makes one attack or uses Mother’s Calling.

Move.name: Move
Move.description: Babylon moves up to her movement speed.

Limited Magic Immunity.name: Limited Magic Immunity
Limited Magic Immunity.description: Unless she wishes to be affected, Babylon is immune to spells of 3rd level or lower. She has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If Babylon fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

Lullaby.name: Lullaby
Lullaby.description: As an action Babylon sings a lullaby to reach out to the children inside all who can hear her within 120 ft. A target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or immediately fall asleep.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
Innate Spellcasting.description:
Babylon can innately cast the following spell, and her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit):
At will: Bane, Cure Wounds (4th Level), Thorn Whip
3/day: Blur, Misty Step, Silence, Fireball, Healing Word (3rd Level), Slow, Sleep (4th Level)
1/day: Divine Word, Chain Lightning, Harm, Heal, Ice Storm, Wall Of Fire, Dominate Person

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description:
Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

materials.value: A drop of blood

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description: Whenever the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

Blur.name: Blur
Blur.description: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight, as with blindsight, or can see through illusions, as with truesight.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

Silence.name: Silence
Silence.description: For the Duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are Deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a Spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: A tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.

A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

materials.value: A drop of molasses.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls &Reference[unconscious] until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren't affected by this spell.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

materials.value: A pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description: The creature affected by this spell falls Unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Divine Word.name: Divine Word
Divine Word.description:
You utter a divine word, imbued with the power that shaped the world at the dawn of Creation. Choose any number of creatures you can see within range. Each creature that can hear you must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature suffers an effect based on its current hit points:

  • 50 Hit Points or fewer: Deafened for 1 minute
  • 40 Hit Points or fewer: Deafened and Blinded for 10 minutes
  • 30 Hit Points or fewer: Blinded, Deafened, and Stunned for 1 Hour
  • 20 Hit Points or fewer: killed instantly

Regardless of its current Hit Points, a Celestial, an elemental, a fey, or a fiend that fails its save is forced back to its plane of Origin (if it isn't there already) and can't return to your current plane for 24 hours by any means short of a wish spell.

Divine Word (40 hp or fewer).name: Divine Word (40 hp or fewer)
Divine Word (40 hp or fewer).description: Creature is Deafened and Blinded for 10 minutes.

Divine Word (30 hp or fewer).name: Divine Word (30 hp or fewer)
Divine Word (30 hp or fewer).description: Creature is Blinded, Deafened, and Stunned for 1 hour.

Chain Lightning.name: Chain Lightning
Chain Lightning.description:
You create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.

A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 10d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional bolt leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

materials.value: A bit of fur; a piece of amber, glass, or a crystal rod; and three silver pins

Harm.name: Harm
Harm.description: You unleash a virulent disease on a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 14d6 necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. The damage can't reduce the target's Hit Points below 1. If the target fails the saving throw, its hit point maximum is reduced for 1 Hour by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it took. Any effect that removes a disease allows a creature's hit point maximum to return to normal before that time passes.

Heal.name: Heal
Heal.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. A surge of positive energy washes through the creature, causing it to regain 70 Hit Points. This spell also ends blindness, deafness, and any Diseases affecting the target. This spell has no effect on constructs or Undead.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the amount of Healing increases by 10 for each slot level above 6th.

Ice Storm.name: Ice Storm
Ice Storm.description:
A hail of rock-hard ice pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d8 bludgeoning damage and 4d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Hailstones turn the storm's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

materials.value: A pinch of dust and a few drops of water

Wall of Fire.name: 火墙术
Wall of Fire.description:
你在施法距离内一块实体地面上创造出一面火墙。你可以选择创造长不过 60 尺、高不过 20 尺、厚不过 1 尺的直线型火墙；或是直径不过 20 尺、高不过 20 尺、厚不过 1 尺的环形火墙。火墙不透明，且将持续存在至法术终止。
